title: Scott McTominay reveals he still talks to Jose Mourinho after Man Utd games
text:
Scott McTominay is still in touch with former Manchester United boss Jose Mourinho (Picture: Getty)

Scott McTominay has revealed that he’s remained in close contact with Jose Mourinho and still talks with his former manager after Manchester United games.

Mourinho gave McTominay his first-team debut back in May 2017 and the 22-year-old academy graduate has since become a regular in United’s midfield, starting all eight Premier League matches under Ole Gunnar Solskjaer’s reign this term.

Mourinho continued to put his trust in McTominay towards the end of his tenure at Old Trafford and repeatedly praised the Scot’s character amid his public spat with Paul Pogba.

McTominay has shone in an otherwise woeful start to this season for United and the youngster believes Solskjaer has the character to get the Red Devils out of their current predicament.

McTominay has started every league match for United this season (Picture: Getty)

He told Sky Sports: ‘You don’t play for Man United for all those years and score some amazing goals without having that [winning mentality] in your DNA.

‘You can see that as a manager and as a player as well.

‘Smiling comes from winning, that’s the way it is and that’s the way life is.

‘Whenever you’re doing well, everybody wants to smile and everybody’s pleased and that’s where we want to get as a group.’

McTominay is confident Solskjaer will get United out of trouble (Picture: Getty)

McTominay says he ‘owes a tremendous amount’ to Mourinho and still speaks with the Portuguese after United matches.

‘He’s special,’ the Scotland international added.

‘Obviously I don’t want to speak too much about previous managers but Jose is very special to me.

‘He still keeps in contact with me now and keeps in touch with me after some games and different things like that.

‘He will always have a special place in mine and my family’s heart because he was the one who brought you here, he was the one who trusted you and he was the one who had belief in you.

‘I owe a tremendous amount of credit to him because, if it wasn’t for him, I might not necessarily be sat in this seat.’
